result.execSummary:
The defendant James L Pruitt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in JOC

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve  9 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 12 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.  3 months STRAIGHT TIME, last 6 months at the day reporting center, or with Huber for work and school.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 18 months probation.

  Conditions of Probation:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution set at zero;
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter.

Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Defendant James L Pruitt in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.  
Court ordered charge amended to Posession of Cocaine, 2nd and Subsequent Offense, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 961.41(3g)(c) and 939.50(3)(i), a Class I Felony.

Attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor in court.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant failing to appear, defense counsel requesting a STAYED bench warrant.  No objection from the state.  Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until 11-07-2014 at 8:30 am.  

Case recalled.  Defense counsel informed the court that defendant was in the hallway and had checked in with the bailiff and requests the stayed bench warrant to be withdrawn.  Court withdraws stayed bench warrant.  Court orders case adjourned to Branch 22 for sentencing hearing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant James L Pruitt in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

Off record.

Defense request for an adjourned plea and sentence date is approved.  Case is adjourned for plea and sentence in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 10-02-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Siefert.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Witkowiak, Br. 22. Case calendared for PLEA and SENTENCING on 8/22/2014 at 8:30 am.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-22-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant James L Pruitt in court with attorney Valeria L Taylor.  Randy P Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
The co-defendant entered a guilty plea on todays date. His counsel entered a substitution request for the sentenceing.

Defendant James L Pruitt in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case is being calendred after the co-defendants case. Case calendared for PROJECTED PLEA on 6/30/2014 at 1:30 pm in Branch 15.

Defendant James L Pruitt in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for STATUS on 3/10/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Defendant James L Pruitt in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant James L Pruitt in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 6, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 01/29/2014 @ 01:30pm
